intro: Pleroma angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pleroma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
